document.title: College and Career Ready Standards for Arts- Theatre Grades 6-12

56A8CE6FF3244741A1F85F72E6BEAA0B.description:
Present and
support an opinion
about the social,
cultural, and historical
understandings of a
drama/theatre work,
based on critical
research.

AA4C6DCE19D44503AB7929F6D968E2E4.description:
Justify the creative
choices made in a
devised or scripted
drama/theatre work,
based on a critical
interpretation of
specific data from
theatre research.

2AD49F60E44C49CFAA6249001A2BF3BA.description:
Explore how
personal beliefs and
biases can affect the
interpretation of
research data applied
in drama/theatre
work.

F510D36C26C64778BF45F15F98F85744.description:
Formulate creative
choices for a devised
or scripted
drama/theatre work
based on theatre
research about the
selected topic.

D5C5D664127742BBA5BD6500B10DD556.description:
b. Use basic theatre
research methods to
better understand the
social and cultural
background of a
drama/theatre work.

2934C13E88BB44F0BE58C855E9D2EBBB.description:
Research how other
theatre artists apply
creative processes to
tell stories in a
devised or scripted
drama/theatre work,
using theatre research
methods.

16D7C5E9F1674EBB82A808201804AEB3.description:
Develop a
drama/theatre work
that identifies and
questions cultural,
global, and historic
belief systems.

459BA81B986847CA9E565A60B9577F76.description:
Integrate
conventions and
knowledge from
different art forms
and other disciplines
to develop a crosscultural
drama/theatre work.

2615CFF0DFBB48228E83A6538AEAD3DE.description:
Explore how
cultural, global, and
historic belief systems
affect creative choices
in a drama/theatre
work.

B795A0E3A8CC41D191E210BABE67AECA.description: Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to deepen understanding.

8EC39B4E631C44D0A55945114FE7CBE1.description:
Collaborate on a
drama/theatre work
that examines a
critical global issue
using multiple
personal, community,
and cultural
perspectives.

C8ED9B776DE149BBB659CBEF2BD842B9.description:
Choose and
interpret a
drama/theatre work
to reflect or question
personal beliefs.

B025F6EDED9D472BA7D95CC2FD472501.description:
a. Investigate how
cultural perspectives,
community ideas and
personal beliefs
impact a
drama/theatre work.

905C9814DC344E5698825B8B8178BC3D.description: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.

4FC6673BBFED40E08D73305819959E6D.description:
Compare and
debate the
connection between a
drama/theatre work
and contemporary
issues that may
impact audiences.

0CEEAC1CE173473DB8E50738057AA6F4.description:
Analyze and
evaluate varied
aesthetic
interpretations of
production elements
for the same
drama/theatre work.

77D471B5BF504F7BAD6008E5EF7919B9.description:
Research and
synthesize cultural
and historical
information related to
a drama/theatre work
to support or evaluate
artistic choices.

FF01232F1E924774A7EAE08B7D3C27E6.description:
Verify how a
drama/theatre work
communicates for a
specific purpose and
audience.

3DE05EA93997472C9C21410EA2D54DCF.description:
Construct meaning
in a drama/theatre
work, considering
personal aesthetics
and knowledge of
production elements
while respecting
others’
interpretations.

3B28DAE351D54DD3A8DC719E63199CD2.description:
Analyze and assess
a drama/theatre work
by connecting it to art
forms, history,
culture, and other
disciplines using
supporting evidence
and criteria.

DB45489B0A72440BADE131D6077E8E58.description: Formulate a deeper understanding and appreciation of a drama/theatre work by considering its specific purpose or intended audience.

5D5126D9640F48779CC62AFBBD3E74B3.description: Consider the aesthetics of the production elements in a drama/theatre work.

620C1145F3E54F94B266DD0330D720B7.description: Examine a drama/theatre work using supporting evidence and criteria, while considering art forms, history, culture, and other disciplines.

D8B7CA3619D646E2A6B8C4696F02E25B.description: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

17A5625FE80846AF9160410AFD074FE3.description: Support and explain aesthetics, preferences, and beliefs to create context for critical research that informs artistic decisions in a drama/theatre work.

E9B53451B4DE48928E12E9AAD72D70DF.description: Use new understandings of cultures and contexts to shape personal responses to drama/theatre work.

2FDFE62C1D704BC69FFE73DF57FF4802.description: Use detailed supporting evidence and appropriate criteria to revise personal work and interpret the work of others when participating in or observing a drama/theatre work.

6FBBF0D6B8F3486CA16E21E3FC5C2AD9.description: Debate and distinguish multiple aesthetics, preferences, and beliefs through participation in and observation of a drama/theatre work.

A32C8DD7CB3A46FE86502633DDB94C73.description: Apply concepts from a drama/theatre work for personal realization about cultural perspectives and understanding.

4450D40B42BD463DB7110C07E6EB6333.description: Develop detailed supporting evidence and criteria to reinforce artistic choices when participating in or observing a drama/theatre work.

5A31FF56AD564309A0A170BB44AAA4EA.description: Justify personal aesthetics, preferences, and beliefs through participation in and observation of a drama/theatre work.

C683A47D05624ECF83C450D13C574B02.description: Identify and compare cultural perspectives and contexts that may influence the evaluation of a drama/theatre work.

B2508100FAFE47B88AD27D3B1A0B1711.description: Analyze and compare artistic choices developed from personal experiences in multiple drama/theatre works.

E65C4D7FA294462394304BAFFF91E3BE.description: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

D6B65271014D4FA395EE76EABE1188D6.description: Use historical and cultural context to structure and justify personal responses to a drama/theatre work.

0AEEEF9C184B41109DE2061872C780E5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of multiple interpretations of artistic criteria and how each might be used to influence future artistic choices of a drama/theatre work.

5EFBB8BDE89D4B648EDEC2070A24748E.description: Respond to what is seen, felt, and heard in a drama/theatre work to develop criteria for artistic choices.

20767ED02F6E48609CD4A67A0B80B985.description: Present a drama/theatre production for a specific audience that employs research and analysis grounded in the creative perspectives of the playwright, director, designer, and dramaturg.

2581DF6ABF4D400A8A701FC8DF762D67.description: Present a drama/theatre work using creative processes that shape the production for a specific audience.

94AD804861044D1CAF0E25D5F8E8B292.description: Perform a scripted drama/theatre work for a specific audience.

11BDD59030D9486FBFD9DC24D3092DAC.description: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

1EA41FEF9A7A4AA99DFDAB77BE705CBC.description: Explain and justify the selection of technical elements used to build a design that communicates the concept of a drama/theatre production.

2246593D162B4BCFAC9BF4023CD12B29.description: Use and justify a collection of acting exercises from reliable resources to prepare a believable and sustainable performance.

082436C5816C41A9B04B39B82F23E7BB.description: Apply technical elements and research to create a design that communicates the concept of a drama/theatre production.

69A75B60DA994C5DB07782E31B7ABDEF.description: Refine a range of acting skills to build a believable and sustainable drama/theatre performance.

6BE51A6068D6466997240EC6E489ABC2.description: Use researched technical elements to increase the impact of design for a drama/theatre production.

085A2F0B1AB94A459D1A6D4F76CF1435.description: Practice various acting techniques to expand skills in a rehearsal or drama/theatre performance.

5AD516BEF2A440B88F54B4BA4F9AE52C.description: Develop and refine artistic techniques and work for presentation.

8E64C660250149318DB07FA514FD8E08.description: Apply a variety of researched acting techniques as an approach to character choices in a drama/theatre work.

92DB672ECCB9425F81DB9691B8323312.description: Apply reliable research of a directors' styles to form unique choices for a directorial concept in a drama/theatre work.

5752C332D10C4697B74261FB70C8FD39.description: Identify essential text information, research from various sources, and the director's concept that influence character choices in a drama/theatre work.

FAE54D0AB98649F3B58819EA934612AC.description: Discover how unique choices shape believable and sustainable drama/theatre work.

0811C5353DD14EEB93C3D76323FB9EE2.description: Shape character choices using given circumstances in a drama/theatre work.

528E561647DC43129AB8820B8F9411E3.description: Examine how character relationships assist in telling the story of a drama/theatre work.

355B9408F1DC41F8846A552AE0C1BA56.description: Select, analyze, and interpret artistic work for presentation.

AAABC88F3C4945539B7CEE70F9641B6C.description: Apply a high level of technical proficiencies to the rehearsal process to support the story and emotional impact of a devised or scripted drama/theatre work.

80933D04673C4B5A95ADF2E23BB09034.description: Synthesize ideas from research, script, analysis, and context to create a performance that is believable, authentic, and relevant in a drama/theatre work.

997DFEF1E2D04DDB92D616FF65326539.description: Refine, transform, and re-imagine a devised or scripted drama/theatre work using the rehearsal process to invent or re-imagine style, genre, form, and conventions.

3424F8A5809C4646B96E5DF0C8B112F3.description: Re-imagine and revise technical design choices during the course of a rehearsal process to enhance the story and emotional impact of a devised or scripted drama/theatre work.

64D8400027E04ED88B0F6D6A27691BD7.description: Use research and script analysis to revise physical, vocal, and physiological choices impacting the believability  and relevance of a drama/theatre work.

550109190BFB4F718CE1A30F288F6358.description: Use the rehearsal process to analyze the dramatic concept and technical design elements of a devised or scripted drama/theatre work.

08C88AFBBCD14CCAB0781745B6B42773.description: Refine technical design choices to support the story and emotional impact of a devised or scripted drama/theatre work.

7834CB4DD68A4996A6FCF1DE5377EF8B.description: Explore physical, vocal, and psychological choices to develop a performance that is believable, authentic, and relevant to a drama/theatre work.

67C2F9C10D214DC091725C743230B3F8.description: Practice and revise a devised or scripted drama/theatre work using theatrical staging conventions.

442D5D8DF51140F7864D9826AAA22F22.description: Collaborate as a creative team to discover artistic solutions and make interpretive choices in a devised or scripted drama/theatre work.

3E1E23A0122E4378A01C803CCBF95101.description: Develop and synthesize original ideas in a drama/theatre work utilizing critical analysis, historical and cultural context, research, and western or non-western theatre traditions.

7C50A1075CDE4657A78E24BE6228B39A.description: Cooperate as a creative team to make interpretive choices for a drama/theatre work.

F8CABAD283BC4C9E95CD6FD9A96E4CB0.description: Refine a dramatic concept to demonstrate a critical understanding of historical and cultural influences of original ideas applied to a drama/theatre work.

C0C483172EE84052B3F7E93AD4AFAC7E.description: Investigate the collaborative nature of the actor, director, playwright, and designers and explore their interdependent roles in a drama/theatre work.

DB519A87CB0945A98E1F74A3EE0F8D7B.description: Explore the function of history and culture in the development of a dramatic concept through a critical analysis of original ideas in a drama/theatre work.

F7907830FEE14F9A900674F24E5DBD1A.description: Organize and develop artistic ideas and work.

A61BA18A84FC4F7887D18306D36E6149.description: Integrate cultural and historical contexts with personal experiences to create a character that is believable and authentic in a drama/theatre work.

4B83E7BA2B8F4D76B54146289AEC9D12.description: Create a complete design for a drama/theatre work that incorporates all elements of technology.

065E39ABBE5646CD960235757E31D7B0.description: Synthesize knowledge from a variety of dramatic forms, theatrical conventions, and technologies to create the visual composition of a drama/theatre work.

8FDCA928B90040628750C86C013C12C5.description: Use personal experiences and knowledge to develop a character that is believable and authentic in a drama/theatre work.

D805CCBF90654AE094EDCF8F8AFF4D96.description: Understand and apply technology to design solutions for a drama/theatre work.

13572F66EEFE4D698F6D8519039DEFB0.description: Investigate historical and cultural conventions and their impact on the visual composition of a drama/theatre work.

D523D8B489E74DA79A217E11B6428A21.description: Use script analysis to generate ideas about a character that is believable and authentic in a drama/theatre work.

FADDFCEE9AF6445993C069F5DF0D1A99.description: Explore the impact of technology on design choices in a drama/theatre work.

78D5C0B0E8834D89AC57A0459627F135.description: Apply basic research to construct ideas about the visual composition of a drama/theatre work.

3618C0A5995D4902818E0B5F89809C49.description: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.
